meanings.definition: Trimmed by cutting away dead or overgrown branches or stems.
meanings.sent1: She pruned the bushes in the garden to make them look neat.
meanings.sent2: The gardener pruned the trees to help them grow better.
meanings.sent3: He pruned the plants so they wouldn't take over the whole yard.
meanings.sent4: The chef pruned the recipe to make it simpler for beginners.
meanings.sent5: The barber pruned the customer's hair with precision and care.

meanings.definition: Reduced by removing unnecessary or unwanted parts.
meanings.sent1: The pruned budget helped the company save money.
meanings.sent2: The pruned version of the document was easier to read.
meanings.sent3: She felt relieved after she pruned her wardrobe and got rid of old clothes.
meanings.sent4: The pruned list of guests made the party more intimate.
meanings.sent5: The pruned tree looked more elegant without the extra branches.
